title: Universal Design for Learning (UDL)-Applied Elementary Mathematics Teacher Writing Competency Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental mathematics pedagogy knowledge and understanding of elementary curricula
context.additional_context: A course for pre-service teachers to master writing techniques for effectively delivering mathematics content and develop educational materials tailored to diverse learning types. Operates in smartphone-centric limited technology environments with continuous feedback via formative assessments.

learning_goals: Improvement of argumentative writing skills systematically explaining mathematical education content (assessment criterion: logical structure completeness ≥80%)
Development of personalized math educational materials considering diverse learner types (personality/learning styles) (project evaluation criteria: reflection of ≥3 learning types)
Strengthening metacognitive competencies by analyzing teaching practices through reflective journaling (writing weekly reflective logs twice and conducting peer feedback)

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
